cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes are characterized by having an immense gravitational pull.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: gravitational pull of a black hole

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes have a set of characteristic physical properties that are being discussed.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: DescriptiveScope: part of the topics to be explored

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes have an extremely strong gravitational pull.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: gravitational pull of a black hole

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a physical object or phenomenon to one of its physical properties or a set of such properties.
args.justification: All three relations describe black holes being associated with inherent physical attributes (gravitational pull, sets of characteristic properties). Normalizing to a single predicate 'has_physical_property' captures this object-to-property semantics more precisely than the generic 'has_property' and applies consistently across individual and grouped properties.

Each relation instance connects a physical astrophysical entity (black holes) to its physical characteristics (gravitational pull and other properties). Grouping them under 'physical_property_relation' provides a reusable class for object–attribute links involving physical quantities or traits.
These relations are not about composition, causality, or hierarchy, but about describing intrinsic attributes of black holes. The broad semantic dimension is therefore an attribute/property grouping.
